explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 435 degC. (Hommmel (1991) Card No.568)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value: 2000 to 4290 mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 2002), the lowest value was adopted and it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value: 930mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 2002), rabbit LD50 value: 930-1184mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 2002), and 2830mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994), the lowest value was adopted and it was set as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It may be Category 2 from the description, but LC50 value is not indicated. So it cannot be classified. The description of PATTY (4th, 1994) is that 3 of 6 rats died with 395ppm (saturated vapor concentration) of 4-hour exposure (equivalent of 1.94mg/L) and that 44 of 106 rats died with 300ppm (judging from the vapor pressure, it is considered to be steam with almost no mist) of 7-hour exposure (4-hour exposure equivalent of 1.95mg/L)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 from description that irritation was found on human skin (CERI Hazard Data of (2002) and PATTY (4th, 1994)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From description that irritant was indicated to the eye of the human (CERI Hazard Data(2002)), and from description that although the eye was stimulated comparatively seriously, critical damage did not occur (PATTY (4th, 1994)), it was set to Category2A.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classified as Category 1 because CERI Hazard Data (2002) describes that skin sensitization is found in humans.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There are negative results from the dominant lethal tests in mice (CERI Hazard Data, 2002, IARC 60, 1994) and from the chromosome aberration tests and the micronucleus tests (intraperitoneal administration or inhalation exposure) using bone-marrow cells from mice and hamsters, which are in vivo mutagenicity tests using somatic cells (CERI Hazard Data, 2002, IARC 60, 1994). But there are positive results from the chromosome aberration tests using oral administration of mouse bone-marrow cells (CERI Hazard Data, 2002, IARC 60, 1994) and there is no positive result in in vivo genotoxicity tests using germ cells. So the substance was classified as Category 2.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It is classified into group 2A according to IARC (IARC 60 (1994)) and into 2A according to Japan Society for Occupational Health (Japan Society for Occupational Health recommendation (2005)), into R according to NTP (NTP RoC (11th, 2005)), and is classified into the category 2 according to EU (EU-Annex I, 2005). So it was set as Category 1B.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there were the reduction of fertility by resorption preimplantation embryo, and the increase of resorption in the dose causing general toxicity such as the death of maternal animals in the rat and rabbit pregnancy inhalation exposure test (CERI Hazard Data (2002), IARC 60 (1994) and PATTY (4th, 1994)), it is classified into the Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Due to the descriptions that central nervous systems may be affected by effect of short-term exposure in ICSC (J) (1994) and of SITTIG (4th, 2002), and that headaches, dizziness, etc. may be started by short-term exposure in HSFS (1999). So it was classified into Category 3 (anesthetic actions).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Since there is the description that it is impaired to human liver in HSFS (1999) and SITTIG (4th, 2002), it is judged that target organ was liver, and it were classified into Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=1.9mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 81% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=1.61 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
